required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Ajyal Salima Longitudinal Study to Prevent Childhood Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: 2-year Intervention and 1-year Follow-up of a School-based Programme to Promote Healthy Behaviours and Prevent Childhood Obesity in Lebanese Children: the Healthier Kids - Ajyal Salima Study

lead_sponsor.agency: American University of Beirut Medical Center

clinical_study.source: American University of Beirut Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The study was carried out to determine the long-term effectiveness of a school-based intervention programme when implemented over 2 years and its sustained effect one year later.

primary_outcome.description: Change in the knowledge scores (the sum of correct answers) based on a scored questionnaire delivered during pre- and all post- assessment phases

Change in the percentage of children consuming sugary drinks, unhealthy and healthy snacks, fruits and vegetables/change in the percentage of children's physical activity frequency (self-reported in the questionnaires during pre- and all post- assessment phases)
Change in the self-efficacy scores (the sum of correct answers) based on a scored questionnaire delivered during pre- and all post- assessment phases
Change in mean BMIz scores (based on anthropometric measurements during pre- and post- assessment phases

arm_group.description: Implementation of Ajyal Salima intervention to promote healthy eating and encourage physical activity in Lebanese school-children.
Group of students not receiving any intervention

intervention.description: It comprises in class-activities, meetings with parents and improvement of school foodservice

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Schoolchildren Aged 8-12 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- no exclusion criteria
